item.title: Fast multi-level model with lme4
item.description: References: Steven V. Miller: Mixed Effects Modeling Tips: Use a Fast Optimizer, but Perform Optimizer Checks lme4: lme4 Performance Tips lme4::glmer vs. Stata’s melogit command library(lme4) f_lmer4_logit2 <- glmer(y ~ x1 + x2 + (1 + x1 | id), data = z, family = binomial(link = "logit"), nAGQ = 0L, control = glmerControl(optimizer="NLOPT_LN_BOBYQA", calc.derivs = FALSE, optCtrl=list(maxfun=2e5, method = "nlminb", starttests = FALSE, kkt = FALSE)))

item.title: 一些阅读清单
item.description: 因果推断 Causal Inference Reading Group Steven V. Miller: An Illustration of Instrumental Variables and a Two-Stage Least Squares (2SLS) Regression Instrumental variable lecture Andrew Heisis: PROGRAM EVALUATION FOR PUBLIC SERVICE Andrew Heisis: ECONOMY, SOCIETY, AND PUBLIC POLICY 空间统计 Geospatial Health Data: Modeling and Visualization with R-INLA and Shiny Advanced Spatial Modeling with Stochastic Partial Differential Equations Using R and INLA spatial data science Bayesian inference with INLA Bivariate Choropleth Maps: A How-to Guide 数据可视化 Andrew Heisis: Telling stories with data Andrew Heisis: Data Visualization Linear mixed effects models Understanding mixed effects models through data simulation Symbolic Formulae for Linear Mixed Models BART Chipman (2010) BART: Bayesian additive regression trees Sparapani (2016) Nonparametric survival analysis using Bayesian Additive Regression Trees (BART) Deep learning Causal Interpretations of Black-Box Models Parallel computing in R A Future for R: A Comprehensive Overview

item.title: Color palettes in R
item.description: R packages ggsci MapPalettes nationalparkcolors wesanderson viridis RColorBrewer colorspace package _brewer() function from ggplot2 Websites colorbrewer 2.0 open color ggplot color best tricks you will love Top R color palettes to know for great data visualization R packages ggsci Scientific Journal and Sci-Fi Themed Color Palettes for ggplot2 NPG: scale_color_npg() and scale_fill_npg() AAAS: scale_color_aaas() and scale_fill_aaas() NEJM Lancet JAMA JCO UCSCGB D3 LocusZoom IGV UChicago Star Trek Tron Legacy Futurama Rick and Morty The Simpsons pacman::p_load(dplyr, ggplot2) mtcars %>% filter(carb <= 4) %>% ggplot(aes(mpg, gear, color = factor(carb))) + geom_point(size = 4) + theme_classic() + ggsci::scale_color_npg() MapPalettes MapPalettes green_machine, irish_flag, tealberry_pie, sunset, the_joker, bruiser # devtools::install_github("disarm-platform/MapPalettes") pacman::p_load(dplyr, ggplot2, MapPalettes) mtcars %>% filter(carb <= 4) %>% ggplot(aes(mpg, gear, color = factor(carb))) + geom_point(size = 4) + theme_classic() + scale_color_manual(values = MapPalettes::map_palette("tealberry_pie", 4)) nationalparkcolors nationalparkcolors # devtools::install_github("katiejolly/nationalparkcolors") pacman::p_load(dplyr, ggplot2, nationalparkcolors) mtcars %>% filter(carb <= 4) %>% ggplot(aes(mpg, gear, color = factor(carb))) + geom_point(size = 4) + theme_classic() + scale_color_manual(values = nationalparkcolors::park_palette("MtRainier", 4)) wesanderson wesanderson R package GitHub Wes Anderson Palettes pacman::p_load(wesanderson) names(wes_palettes) ## [1] "BottleRocket1" "BottleRocket2" "Rushmore1" "Rushmore" ## [5] "Royal1" "Royal2" "Zissou1" "Darjeeling1" ## [9] "Darjeeling2" "Chevalier1" "FantasticFox1" "Moonrise1" ## [13] "Moonrise2" "Moonrise3" "Cavalcanti1" "GrandBudapest1" ## [17] "GrandBudapest2" "IsleofDogs1" "IsleofDogs2" # devtools::install_github("karthik/wesanderson") pacman::p_load(dplyr, ggplot2, wesanderson) mtcars %>% filter(carb <= 4) %>% ggplot(aes(mpg, gear, color = factor(carb))) + geom_point(size = 4) + theme_classic() + scale_color_manual(values = wesanderson::wes_palette(n = 4, name = "GrandBudapest1")) viridis viridis

item.title: 学术英文例句学习
item.description: The effect of cardiovascular outcomes has been less well characterized. The Trouble With Trucking But those drivers are the top echelon of the occupation and are not representative of the hundreds of thousands of people who toil in the industry’s underbelly. The previous requirements raised the cost of moving goods and stifled competition, but deregulation also took a toll on drivers by giving the industry a bigger financial incentive to lower costs and by weakening unions.

item.title: Data visualization using ggplot2
item.description: Kaplan-Meier survival plots using survminer One Kaplan-Meier plot using survminer survminer::ggsurvplot(survfit(utotalPSM ~ integ, data = total), pval = TRUE, conf.int = TRUE, legend.title = "Hospital type", legend.labs = c("Ordinary Hospitals", "Medical Consortium Hospitals"), submain = "Kaplan-Meier plot for a pool of three patient cohorts", xlab = "Survival length of stay", palette = c("firebrick1", "green4"), font.submain = c(16, "bold")) Arrange 3 survival plots plot3cohorts = survminer::arrange_ggsurvplots( list(ggfei.m, ggwei.m, ggshiguan.m), nrow = 3, ncol = 1) Code and data.

item.title: Rmarkdown .pdf tricks
item.description: LaTeX Header To make a lot of tricks work, you need to header-includes: - \usepackage{setspace}: spacing \doublespacing \singlespacing \linespread{1.5} - \AtBeginDocument{\let\maketitle\relax}: do not make title - \usepackage{lineno} \linenumbers - \usepackage[bottom]{footmisc}: make footnote on the first page to bottom - \usepackage{dcolumn}: to make stargazer tables work - \usepackage{lscape}: \newcommand{\blandscape}{\begin{landscape}} \newcommand{\elandscape}{\end{landscape}} Make a box around the content: \fbox{\begin{minipage}{\linewidth} 1. (11 Points: 2,3,3,3) Researchers are interested in .

item.title: INLA贝叶斯模型
item.description: 一些有用的参考文献： Virgilio Gómez-Rubio (2020) Bayesian inference with INLA, Faraway, Julian (2016) INLA for linear mixed models. A gentle INLA tutorial, Haakon Bakka (2017) Small Tutorials on INLA, Wang Xiaofeng (2019) Bayesian Regression Modeling with INLA, Paula Moraga (2019) Geospatial Health Data: Modeling and Visualization with R-INLA and Shiny options(repos = c(getOption("repos"), INLA="https://inla.r-inla-download.org/R/stable")) install.packages("INLA", dep = TRUE) pacman::p_load(INLA) Generalized linear models Logistic regression fit1 = inla(y ~ x1 + x2 + x3, data = d, family = "binomial", control.
